etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in George Grote (1794–1871), historian and politician. From ancient Greek οἰκιστής founder of a colony from οἰκίζειν to found as a colony (from οἶκος house, dwelling (cognate with classical Latin vīcus quarter of a city, and further with Gothic weihs village) + -ίζειν) + -ιστής

definitions: The founder of a colony in ancient Greece. Hence allusively: the founder of a colony in more recent times.
